abstract: The Obama administration wants to open government with social networks. Privacy advocates worry that gives the government too much access to our lives.
snippet: The Obama administration wants to open government with social networks. Privacy advocates worry that gives the government too much access to our lives.
lead_paragraph: Last week, President Obama extended his use of social media sites, a trademark feature of his campaign, into the White House, setting up on MySpace, Facebook, Twitter and Flickr. The president, of course, has had an official blog, and he has been posting White House video on YouTube and other video sites.

headline.main: Should the White House Be a Place for Friends?
